usefulItems: cling film, large frying pan, large bowl, refrigerator, hob
title: Beetroot and Halloumi Burgers

ingredients.content: 240 g tinned chickpeas, rinsed, drained (1 x 400 g tin)
3 fresh red chillies, halved, deseeded if desired

preparations.content: Place bread in mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.
Place chickpeas, beetroot, garlic, parsley, cumin, salt and pepper in mixing bowl then chop <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add egg and mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer to bowl with breadcrumbs and stir with spatula until combined.
Shape mixture into 6 patties (approx. 110 g each, Ø 8 cm). Transfer to a plate, cover with cling film and place in fridge for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and prepare chilli jam.

Place red peppers and chillies in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then chop again <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sugar, vinegar and water then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, cook <b>20-25 min/Varoma/speed 0.5<b> until desired consistency is reached.
Heat oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat and fry chilled beetroot patties until browned and crisp on the edges (approx. 3-4 minutes on each side). Transfer to a plate and keep warm.
In the same frying pan, fry halloumi until lightly golden (approx. 1-2 minutes on each side).
Serve patties in brioche buns, with slices of halloumi and chilli jam to taste.

hintsAndTricks: Sweet, earthy beetroot, smoky cumin and fresh parsley come together to make these fantastic veggie burgers. Shaped into colourful patties that are pan-fried until crispy, then served in a sweet brioche bun with homemade chilli jam, these burgers are real crowd-pleasers.
Serve with sweet potato fries and a side salad for a complete meal.
